newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-BHP says Griffin oil restarts output.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-BHP says Griffin oil restarts output.

text.p: The Griffin Joint Venture offshore oil platform resumed production late on Sunday after being shut-in since last Thursday due to bad weather, a spokesman for the operator, The Broken Hill Pty Co Ltd, said on Monday.
"It went back into production last night (Sunday) after a three day shutdown," the spokesman told Reuters.
Production would gradually be ramped up to previous levels, he said.
The platform has a capacity of 80,000 barrels per day from the Griffin field off the coast of Western Australia.
BHP holds a 45 percent stake in the Griffin field, Mobil Corp 35 percent and Inpex Alpha Ltd 20 percent.
